dji.sdk.api.RemoteController

Class DJIInspireRemoteController

  • java.lang.Object
    • dji.sdk.api.RemoteController.DJIRemoteController
      • dji.sdk.api.RemoteController.DJIInspireRemoteController

  • public class DJIInspireRemoteController
extends DJIRemoteController

    DJI Inspire Remote Controller

    The DJIInspireRemoteController extends the DJIRemoteController for Inspire 1 remote controller. Several functions which are only supported by Inspire are included in this class. For example, the user could use this function for setting up the slave(s) and master, set up the slave's permission, search nearby master controller, etc.

    For making good use of the remote control, we provide a new updating strategy for getting information from remote control. Once there were any change in the remote controller, the remote controller will push the data to app. Hence, developers could listen the change which happens in the remote control and could implement something, such as the usage of customer define button.
    Version:
    : V2.4.0
    Author:
    : DJI Software

      • SetCalibration

        public void SetCalibration(DJIRemoteControllerTypeDef.DJIRemoteControllerCalibrationStatus command,
                           DJIRemoteControllerCalibrationStatusCallBack mCallBack)
        This will start the remote control calibration. There are three kinds of calibration mode.
        0x01 - Record the middle value.
        0x02 - Record the Maximum or Minimum
        0x03 - Quit the Calibration
        Overrides:
        SetCalibration in class DJIRemoteController
        Parameters:
        result - - the result will execute the code in DJIReomoteControlCalibrationStatusCallBack
        See Also:
        dji.sdk.api.RemoteController.DJIRemoteControllerTypeDef#DJIRemoteControllerCalibrationStatus

      • getHardwareParams

        public void getHardwareParams(DJIRemoteControllerGetChannelParamsCallBack mCallBack)
        Invoking this function will set up a call back which will return the value in different channel.
        The physical channel value range is [364, 1684]. In addition, the middle value is 1024.
        Please note that if the request fails, the callback will return a arrary list without any elements.
        Overrides:
        getHardwareParams in class DJIRemoteController

      • getMasterControlMode

        public void getMasterControlMode(DJIRemoteControllerModeCallBack mCallBack)
        Get the control mode of the connecting remote controller
        Overrides:
        getMasterControlMode in class DJIRemoteController
        Parameters:
        mCallBack - - the call back will return two kinds of information. For one thing, the DJI predefined control mode (chinese, japanese, america and customer). If the control mode is customer define, the channelTypeList will contain the customer preference information.
        onResult(DJIRemoteControllerControlMode mode, ArrayList channelTypeList) -
        See Also:
        dji.sdk.api.RemoteController.DJIRemoteControllerCustoemrPreference

      • getGimbalCtrPermission

        public void getGimbalCtrPermission(DJIExecuteIntResultCallback mCallBack)
        Get the permission of controlling the gimbal
        Overrides:
        getGimbalCtrPermission in class DJIRemoteController
        Parameters:
        mCallBack - Return the request result.
        onResult(int result) - the result for permission of gimbal control.
        0x00 - allow
        0x01 - not allow
        0x02 - Over time
